data.name: Quality Education on Software Design Principles
data.statement: The system shall support the educational objectives by providing examples of software design principles.

data.name: Quality Education on Software Analysis
data.statement: The system shall include features that support teaching software analysis.

data.name: Quality Education on Requirements Traceability
data.statement: The system shall include features that support teaching requirements traceability.

data.name: Visual Examples of Requirements Traceability
data.statement: The system shall include visual representations of real-world requirements traceability examples.

data.name: User-Friendly Tool for Requirements Traceability
data.statement: The system shall be user-friendly and visually demonstrate the principles of requirements traceability.

data.name: Support Common SW Development Models
data.statement: The system shall support various software development methodologies, including waterfall, iterative-incremental, and agile.

data.name: Custom Item Types
data.statement: The system shall enable users to define custom item types.

data.name: Custom User Levels
data.statement: The system shall enable users to define custom user levels.

data.name: Custom Levels for Requirements
data.statement: The system shall allow users to define levels for requirements, each characterized by a color.

data.name: Display Different Versions of Traceability Hierarchy
data.statement: The system shall manage and display different versions of the traceability hierarchy.

data.name: Inform User About Traceability Issues
data.statement: The system shall provide warnings about potential issues in the traceability hierarchy.

data.name: Visual Management of Traceability Hierarchy
data.statement: The system shall support visual adding, editing, and removing of hierarchy items and their relationships.

data.name: Display Traceability Hierarchy
data.statement: The system shall visually display the traceability hierarchy.

data.name: Display Lineage of Hierarchy Item
data.statement: The system shall enable the user to see the backward and forward lineage of any hierarchy item.

data.name: Automatic Derivation of Relationships from Git Commits
data.statement: The system shall automatically derive relationships from git commits mentioning requirements IDs.

data.name: Enforce Item Type Selection
data.statement: The system shall enforce the selection of an item type for each new hierarchy item.

data.name: Enforce User Level Selection
data.statement: The system shall enforce the selection of a user level for each new requirement.

data.name: Support Internal Levels Within User Level Hierarchy
data.statement: The system shall support defining internal levels within a user level hierarchy.

data.name: Arrange Nodes Within Traceability Hierarchy
data.statement: The system shall enable rearranging nodes in the traceability graph for better visualization.

data.name: Create a Project
data.statement: The system shall enable users to create a project by specifying the project name, repository URL, and access token.

data.name: Delete a Project
data.statement: The system shall enable users to delete an existing project.

data.name: Add a New Release to a Project
data.statement: The system shall enable users to add a new release to an existing project.

data.name: Delete a Release from a Project
data.statement: The system shall enable users to delete an existing release from a project.

data.name: View Archived Releases
data.statement: The system shall enable users to view, but not edit, archived releases.

data.name: Add an Item to the Current Project
data.statement: The system shall enable users to add new items to the current project.

data.name: Delete an Item from the Current Project
data.statement: The system shall enable users to delete items from the current project.

data.name: Edit an Item in the Current Project
data.statement: The system shall enable users to edit items in the current project.

data.name: Validate Repository During Project Creation
data.statement: The system shall validate that the repository URL is valid and accessible with the provided access token.

data.name: Validate Relationships to Avoid Cycles
data.statement: The system shall prevent the creation of relationships that would introduce cycles in the traceability graph.

data.name: Validate Status Changes of Items
data.statement: The system shall enforce specific conditions when changing the status of items.

data.name: Validate Item Edits and Provide Warnings
data.statement: The system shall notify users of potential issues when editing items.

data.name: Warn on Editing Requirement with Child Items
data.statement: The system shall warn users when editing a requirement with child items without updating the child items.

data.name: Warn on Changing Status of Requirement with SourceArtifact Children
data.statement: The system shall warn users when changing the status of a requirement with SourceArtifact children without updating the status of the SourceArtifact items.

data.name: Suppress Warnings Option
data.statement: The system shall provide an option to suppress warnings when editing items or changing their status.

data.name: Handle Iterations/Increments
data.statement: The system shall specify how to handle iterations and increments.

data.name: Provide Real-World Examples
data.statement: The system shall provide real-world examples of requirements traceability in a visual way.

data.name: Employ User-Friendly SW Tool
data.statement: The system shall employ an easy-to-use software tool that demonstrates basic principles of requirements traceability.
